meanings.definition: The belief in or practice of disinterested and selfless concern for the well-being of others.
meanings.sent1: Her altruism was evident when she volunteered at the homeless shelter every weekend.
meanings.sent2: Many people admire Mother Teresa for her altruism and dedication to helping the poor.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel showed altruism by sharing its nuts with the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of selfishness, her altruism shone like a beacon of light.
meanings.sent5: The concept of altruism teaches us to prioritize the needs of others over our own desires.

meanings.definition: Behavior that is motivated by a selfless concern for the well-being of others.
meanings.sent1: His altruism was evident in the way he always put others' needs before his own.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter's altruism led him to rush into the burning building to save the trapped family.
meanings.sent3: The cat's altruism was questionable when it pushed the vase off the table to get attention.
meanings.sent4: Altruism is like a warm hug on a cold day, comforting and selfless.
meanings.sent5: The true test of altruism is whether one can give without expecting anything in return.
